items.title: Man sprays Rep. Ilhan Omar with unknown substance at town hall
items.standfirst: Rep. Ilhan Omar was calling for the abolishment of ICE and for Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem to resign when a man sitting in the front row rushed up and sprayed her. He was arrested and Omar was not injured, police said.

items.title: Congresswoman Ilhan Omar sprayed with unknown substance at Minneapolis town hall
items.standfirst: Man arrested and charged with assault after spraying strong-smelling liquid at Minnesota Democrat from syringeCongresswoman Ilhan Omar was sprayed with an unidentified substance by a man with a syringe on Tuesday as she gave her first in-person town hall of the year in Minneapolis, during which she called for ICE to be abolished “for good” and DHS secretary Kristi Noem to resign.Omar had only been speaking for a few minutes when a man in the audience got up and began to shout, while spraying her with the liquid. People at the meeting said the liquid had an acidic smell. Continue reading...
items.content: Man arrested and charged with assault after spraying strong-smelling liquid at Minnesota Democrat from syringeCongresswoman Ilhan Omar was sprayed with an unidentified substance by a man with a syringe on Tuesday as she gave her first in-person town hall of the year in Minneapolis, during which she called for ICE to be abolished “for good” and DHS secretary Kristi Noem to resign.Omar had only been speaking for a few minutes when a man in the audience got up and began to shout, while spraying her with the liquid. People at the meeting said the liquid had an acidic smell. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Trump administration seeks de-escalation in Minneapolis amid backlash
clusters.neutral_headline: Republicans wrestle with immigration message after Minneapolis backlash

items.title: Trump administration seeks de-escalation in Minneapolis amid backlash
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on January 27, a “big investigation” was underway into the killing of protester and ICU nurse Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis. It marks a shift from the White House after the incident sparked outrage and nationwide protests. Many suspect the departure of Greg Bovino, the commander of Donald Trump's immigration crackdown, was a sign the administration was changing course.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on January 27, a “big investigation” was underway into the killing of protester and ICU nurse Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis. It marks a shift from the White House after the incident sparked outrage and nationwide protests. Many suspect the departure of Greg Bovino, the commander of Donald Trump's immigration crackdown, was a sign the administration was changing course.

items.title: France Issues US Travel Advisory

An update on the French foreign ministry website on January 24, that it says is still valid, said that local…

items.standfirst: Some lawmakers are questioning the crackdown as public anger grows over two citizens killed by federal agents.
items.content: Some lawmakers are questioning the crackdown as public anger grows over two citizens killed by federal agents.

items.title: Trump backs down on immigration enforcement push after Minneapolis shootings
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump sent border czar Tom Homan to Minneapolis on Tuesday to ease tensions after two US citizens were shot dead by federal agents, signalling a shift in the administration’s aggressive immigration enforcement tactics. Homan met with the city’s mayor and the governor of Minnesota amid growing political pressure and public outrage.
items.content: President Donald Trump sent border czar Tom Homan to Minneapolis on Tuesday to ease tensions after two US citizens were shot dead by federal agents, signalling a shift in the administration’s aggressive immigration enforcement tactics. Homan met with the city’s mayor and the governor of Minnesota amid growing political pressure and public outrage.

clusters.title: French former senator found guilty of drugging MP with intent to sexually assault her
clusters.neutral_headline: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP

items.title: French former senator found guilty of drugging MP with intent to sexually assault her
items.standfirst: Joël Guerriau sentenced to four years in prison after spiking lawmaker’s champagne with ecstasyA former French senator has been found guilty of drugging a fellow politician in order to sexually assault her, in a case that has shaken French politics.Joël Guerriau, 68, was sentenced on Tuesday evening to four years in prison of which 18 months must be behind bars. He has appealed against the verdict, which means he will not immediately serve his sentence and instead will face a fresh trial at a later date.In the UK, Rape Crisis offers support for rape and sexual abuse on 0808 802 9999 in England and Wales, 0808 801 0302 in Scotland, or 0800 0246 991 in Northern Ireland. In the US, Rainn offers support on 800-656-4673. In Australia, support is available at 1800Respect (1800 737 732). Other international helplines can be found at ibiblio.org/rcip/internl.html Continue reading...
items.content: Joël Guerriau sentenced to four years in prison after spiking lawmaker’s champagne with ecstasyA former French senator has been found guilty of drugging a fellow politician in order to sexually assault her, in a case that has shaken French politics.Joël Guerriau, 68, was sentenced on Tuesday evening to four years in prison of which 18 months must be behind bars. He has appealed against the verdict, which means he will not immediately serve his sentence and instead will face a fresh trial at a later date.In the UK, Rape Crisis offers support for rape and sexual abuse on 0808 802 9999 in England and Wales, 0808 801 0302 in Scotland, or 0800 0246 991 in Northern Ireland. In the US, Rainn offers support on 800-656-4673. In Australia, support is available at 1800Respect (1800 737 732). Other international helplines can be found at ibiblio.org/rcip/internl.html Continue reading...

items.title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP
items.standfirst: Joel Guerriau received a four-year prison sentence, 18 months of which are to be served behind bars.
items.content: Joel Guerriau received a four-year prison sentence, 18 months of which are to be served behind bars.

items.title: French ex-senator found guilty of spiking MP's drink to sexually assault her
items.standfirst: A French court on Tuesday found former senator Joel Guerriau guilty of spiking lawmaker Sandrine Josso's champagne in November 2023 in order to sexually abuse her. The court sentenced him to four years in prison, of which 18 months must be behind bars.
items.content: A French court on Tuesday found former senator Joel Guerriau guilty of spiking lawmaker Sandrine Josso's champagne in November 2023 in order to sexually abuse her. The court sentenced him to four years in prison, of which 18 months must be behind bars.

clusters.title: US dollar sinks to its lowest level in four years
clusters.neutral_headline: US dollar sinks to its lowest level in four years

items.title: US dollar sinks to its lowest level in four years
items.standfirst: Dollar drops against basket of currencies after Donald Trump brushed off concerns over slideBusiness live – latest updatesThe US dollar has fallen to its lowest level in four years after Donald Trump brushed off concerns over the currency’s fall, sending investors fleeing to traditional havens including gold and the Swiss franc.The dollar dropped by 1.3% against a basket of currencies after the president’s comments on Tuesday, marking its fourth day of declines, then slipped by a further 0.2% on Wednesday morning. Continue reading...
items.content: Dollar drops against basket of currencies after Donald Trump brushed off concerns over slideBusiness live – latest updatesThe US dollar has fallen to its lowest level in four years after Donald Trump brushed off concerns over the currency’s fall, sending investors fleeing to traditional havens including gold and the Swiss franc.The dollar dropped by 1.3% against a basket of currencies after the president’s comments on Tuesday, marking its fourth day of declines, then slipped by a further 0.2% on Wednesday morning. Continue reading...

items.title: US dollar extends fall after Trump dismisses concerns over weaker currency
items.standfirst: The US dollar weakened to its lowest level in four years on Tuesday after President Donald Trump responded to a question about the currency's fall by saying he thought it was "great". In this edition, we try to understand why Trump favours a lower currency and the factors that have been weighing on the greenback. Also in the headlines, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer heads to China with a delegation of 60 business executives.
items.content: The US dollar weakened to its lowest level in four years on Tuesday after President Donald Trump responded to a question about the currency's fall by saying he thought it was "great". In this edition, we try to understand why Trump favours a lower currency and the factors that have been weighing on the greenback. Also in the headlines, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer heads to China with a delegation of 60 business executives.

items.title: Dollar Falls, Hovers Close to Lowest Since 2022
items.standfirst: 28 min ago Dollar Falls, Hovers Close to Lowest Since 2022 The dollar fell, staying near its weakest in nearly four years. It hit this low late Tuesday after President Donald Trump was asked if the dollar had declined too much and said: "No, I think it's great." The dollar was already weak on…

items.title: Passengers killed in drone attack on Ukraine train
items.standfirst: A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in Ukraine’s northeastern Kharkiv region has killed at least five people.
items.content: A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in Ukraine’s northeastern Kharkiv region has killed at least five people.

items.title: Zelensky condemns Russian drone strike that killed five on passenger train
items.standfirst: Drones targeted a packed train in north-eastern Ukraine, officials say.
items.content: Drones targeted a packed train in north-eastern Ukraine, officials say.

items.title: Russian drone strike on Ukrainian passenger train kills five
items.standfirst: Attack in Kharkiv region was denounced as terrorism by Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said it undermined ‘efforts to end the war’A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in north-eastern Ukraine has killed five people, prosecutors said, an attack denounced as terrorism by president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.Prosecutors said fragments of five bodies had been found at the scene of the strike on the train, which occurred on Tuesday near a village in Ukraine’s Kharkiv region. Continue reading...
items.content: Attack in Kharkiv region was denounced as terrorism by Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said it undermined ‘efforts to end the war’A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in north-eastern Ukraine has killed five people, prosecutors said, an attack denounced as terrorism by president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.Prosecutors said fragments of five bodies had been found at the scene of the strike on the train, which occurred on Tuesday near a village in Ukraine’s Kharkiv region. clusters.title: TikTok settles landmark social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial
clusters.neutral_headline: TikTok settles just before social media addiction trial to begin

items.title: TikTok settles landmark social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial
items.standfirst: TikTok has agreed to settle a major lawsuit claiming its platform deliberately addicted and harmed children, just days before the trial was set to begin. The case, which also involves Meta’s Instagram, Google’s YouTube and Snap, could influence hundreds of similar lawsuits targeting social media companies over youth mental health and safety.
items.content: TikTok has agreed to settle a major lawsuit claiming its platform deliberately addicted and harmed children, just days before the trial was set to begin. The case, which also involves Meta’s Instagram, Google’s YouTube and Snap, could influence hundreds of similar lawsuits targeting social media companies over youth mental health and safety.

items.title: TikTok settles just before social media addiction trial to begin
items.standfirst: Defendants include Meta, which owns Instagram and Facebook, and YouTube parent Google.
items.content: Defendants include Meta, which owns Instagram and Facebook, and YouTube parent Google.

items.title: TikTok Joins Snap Settling Youth Addiction Suit Before Trial
items.standfirst: TikTok is moving to settle a lawsuit with a woman who alleged that the company and other social media giants designed their platforms to addict young users, the first such case to go to trial.
items.content: TikTok is moving to settle a lawsuit with a woman who alleged that the company and other social media giants designed their platforms to addict young users, the first such case to go to trial.

clusters.title: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Corporate Jobs as AI Competition Intensifies
clusters.neutral_headline: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Corporate Jobs as AI Competition Intensifies

items.title: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Corporate Jobs as AI Competition Intensifies
items.standfirst: Amazon.com announced plans to terminate about 16,000 corporate employees, only a few months after announcing it was cutting 14,000 roles. The company will offer US-based employees 90 days to search for a new role internally, as well as severance and other transition support. Mandeep Singh of Bloomberg Intelligence has more. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Amazon.com announced plans to terminate about 16,000 corporate employees, only a few months after announcing it was cutting 14,000 roles. The company will offer US-based employees 90 days to search for a new role internally, as well as severance and other transition support. Mandeep Singh of Bloomberg Intelligence has more. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Amazon to cut 16,000 jobs globally
items.standfirst: Amazon has told staff it plans to cut around 16,000 jobs globally as part of efforts to streamline operations and reduce bureaucracy across the business.
items.content: Amazon has told staff it plans to cut around 16,000 jobs globally as part of efforts to streamline operations and reduce bureaucracy across the business.

items.title: Amazon Plans to Cut 16,000 Jobs as AI Competition Heats Up

items.title: US announces multi-day aerial military drills in the Middle East amid Iran tensions
items.standfirst: Exercises described by President Trump as an ‘armada’ to be led by the USS Abraham Lincoln amid standoffThe US has announced plans to hold multi-day military exercises in the Middle East as it deploys what Donald Trump has called an “armada” led by the USS Abraham Lincoln to the region as part of a tense standoff with Iran.The display of US air power was announced as the White House has suggested it could launch new strikes on Iran after the government’s crackdown on pro-democracy protesters that has left thousands dead and many more in detention with their fates uncertain. Continue reading...

items.content: World’s richest person targeting symbolic date in June for flotation of rocket company Elon Musk’s SpaceX is considering a flotation valuing the rocket company at $1.5tn (£1.1tn) that will reportedly be timed for early summer to coincide with a planetary alignment and the multibillionaire’s…

items.title: SpaceX mulls $1.5tn IPO timed to ‘align with Musk’s birthday and the planets’
items.standfirst: World’s richest person targeting symbolic date in June for flotation of rocket companyElon Musk’s SpaceX is considering a flotation valuing the rocket company at $1.5tn (£1.1tn) that will reportedly be timed for early summer to coincide with a planetary alignment and the multibillionaire’s birthday.The world’s richest person is targeting a symbolic date of mid-June for the initial public offering, according to the Financial Times. This would be around the same time as Jupiter and Venus appear in close proximity to each other and shortly before Musk turns 55 on 28 June. Continue reading...
items.content: World’s richest person targeting symbolic date in June for flotation of rocket companyElon Musk’s SpaceX is considering a flotation valuing the rocket company at $1.5tn (£1.1tn) that will reportedly be timed for early summer to coincide with a planetary alignment and the multibillionaire’s birthday.The world’s richest person is targeting a symbolic date of mid-June for the initial public offering, according to the Financial Times. This would be around the same time as Jupiter and Venus appear in close proximity to each other and shortly before Musk turns 55 on 28 June. Continue reading...

items.title: The price gap between Waymo and Uber is narrowing

But that gap is narrowing, according to new data published Tuesday by Obi, a company that aggregates real-time pricing and pickup times across multiple ride-hailing services. Two…

items.title: New Data Shows Robotaxis Competing on Price—and Speed

items.title: Amazon reveals fresh round of global job cuts in email sent in error to workers
items.standfirst: Message erroneously said affected employees in the US, Canada and Costa Rica had already been informed Business live – latest updates Amazon has told workers of a fresh round of global job cuts in an email that appears to have been sent in error. Workers at Amazon Web Services (AWS) received a…

items.title: Amazon reveals fresh round of global job cuts in email sent in error to workers
items.standfirst: Message erroneously said affected employees in the US, Canada and Costa Rica had already been informedBusiness live – latest updatesAmazon has told workers of a fresh round of global job cuts in an email that appears to have been sent in error.Workers at Amazon Web Services (AWS) received a meeting invitation from a top executive on Tuesday for the following day – subsequently cancelled – that also contained a draft email. Continue reading...

items.title: Malaysia football officials quit over foreign-born players scandal
items.standfirst: Fifa had accused Malaysia's football association of doctoring citizenship documents.
items.content: Fifa had accused Malaysia's football association of doctoring citizenship documents.

items.title: Top Malaysian football officials quit over foreign-born players scandal
items.standfirst: Resignations come amid scrutiny of Malaysian football after it fielded foreign-born players in its Asian Cup qualifiers.
items.content: Resignations come amid scrutiny of Malaysian football after it fielded foreign-born players in its Asian Cup qualifiers.

clusters.title: South Korea court sentences ex-first lady to 20 months in prison for corruption
clusters.neutral_headline: South Korea’s former first lady sentenced to jail term in bribery case

items.title: South Korea court sentences ex-first lady to 20 months in prison for corruption
items.standfirst: A South Korean court on Wednesday sentenced the country's former first lady, Kim Keon Hee, to 20 months in prison for receiving bribes from the Unification Church. Her husband, who has been jailed separately for months, is awaiting a verdict on charges related to his declaration of martial law in 2024.
items.content: A South Korean court on Wednesday sentenced the country's former first lady, Kim Keon Hee, to 20 months in prison for receiving bribes from the Unification Church. Her husband, who has been jailed separately for months, is awaiting a verdict on charges related to his declaration of martial law in 2024.

items.title: South Korea’s former first lady sentenced to jail term in bribery case
items.standfirst: Kim Keon Hee's husband, Yoon Suk Yeol, could be facing the death penalty over his declaration of martial law in 2024.
items.content: Kim Keon Hee's husband, Yoon Suk Yeol, could be facing the death penalty over his declaration of martial law in 2024.

clusters.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
clusters.neutral_headline: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba

items.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
items.standfirst: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.
items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)

items.title: Mexico’s president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‘sovereign’ decision
items.standfirst: Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‘zero’ oil would go to CubaMexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba, the country’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was “sovereign” and not a response to pressure from the US.Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island’s biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month. Continue reading...
